remarks: A version of the Archimedean property.  This variation is "stronger" than ~ archnqq in the sense that we provide an integer which is larger than a given rational ` A ` even after being multiplied by a second rational ` B ` .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 30-Nov-2019.)
statement:
prarloclemarch $p |- ( ( A e. Q. /\ B e. Q. ) -> E. x e. N. A <Q ( [ <. x , 1o >. ] ~Q .Q B ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
